alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:00PM EDT until June 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR WESTERN CALHOUN COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 200 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Arlington, or 7 miles southwest of Morgan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Calhoun County in southwestern Georgia, including the following locations... Commissary Hill, Turman, Dickey and Parksville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
